title: cellsnp
description: cellSNP aims to pileup the expressed alleles in single-cell or bulk RNA-seq data. It can be directly used for donor deconvolution in multiplexed single-cell RNA-seq data, particularly with vireo.

sam_file.description: Type: `file`. Indexed sam/bam file(s), comma separated multiple samples
sam_file.help_text: Type: `file`. Indexed sam/bam file(s), comma separated multiple samples. Mode 1a & 2a: one sam/bam file with single cell. Mode 1b & 2b: one or multiple bulk sam/bam files, no barcodes needed, but sample ids and regionsVCF.

sam_index_file.description: Type: `file`. Input SAM/BAM Index file, problem with samFileList
sam_index_file.help_text: Type: `file`. Input SAM/BAM Index file, problem with samFileList.

sam_fileList.description: Type: `file`. A list file containing bam files, each per line, for Mode 1b & 2b
sam_fileList.help_text: Type: `file`. A list file containing bam files, each per line, for Mode 1b & 2b.

regions_vcf.description: Type: `file`. A vcf file listing all candidate SNPs, for fetch each variants
regions_vcf.help_text: Type: `file`. A vcf file listing all candidate SNPs, for fetch each variants. If None, pileup the genome. Needed for bulk samples.

targets_vcf.description: Type: `file`. Similar as --regions_vcf, but the next position is accessed by streaming rather than indexing/jumping (like -T in samtools/bcftools mpileup)
targets_vcf.help_text: Type: `file`. Similar as --regions_vcf, but the next position is accessed by streaming rather than indexing/jumping (like -T in samtools/bcftools mpileup).

barcode_file.description: Type: `file`. A plain file listing all effective cell barcode
barcode_file.help_text: Type: `file`. A plain file listing all effective cell barcode.

sample_list.description: Type: `file`. A list file containing sample IDs, each per line
sample_list.help_text: Type: `file`. A list file containing sample IDs, each per line.

genotype.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If use, do genotyping in addition to counting
genotype.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If use, do genotyping in addition to counting.

gzip.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If use, the output files will be zipped into BGZF format
gzip.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If use, the output files will be zipped into BGZF format.

print_skip_snps.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If use, the SNPs skipped when loading VCF will be printed.

chrom.description: Type: `string`. The chromosomes to use in integer format 1-22, comma separated
chrom.help_text: Type: `string`. The chromosomes to use in integer format 1-22, comma separated

cell_tag.description: Type: `string`, default: `CB`. Tag for cell barcodes, turn off with None
cell_tag.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `CB`. Tag for cell barcodes, turn off with None.

umi_tag.description: Type: `string`, default: `Auto`. Tag for UMI: UR, Auto, None
umi_tag.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `Auto`. Tag for UMI: UR, Auto, None. For Auto mode, use UR if barcodes is inputted, otherwise use None. None mode means no UMI but read counts.

min_maf.description: Type: `double`, default: `0.0`. Minimum minor allele frequency
min_maf.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `0.0`. Minimum minor allele frequency.

doublet_gl.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If use, keep doublet GT likelihood, i
doublet_gl.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If use, keep doublet GT likelihood, i.e., GT=0.5 and GT=1.5.

incl_flag.description: Type: `string`. Required flags: skip reads with all mask bits unset
incl_flag.help_text: Type: `string`. Required flags: skip reads with all mask bits unset.

excl_flag.description: Type: `string`. Filter flags: skip reads with any mask bits set [UNMAP,SECONDARY,QCFAIL (when use UMI) or UNMAP,SECONDARY,QCFAIL,DUP (otherwise)]
excl_flag.help_text: Type: `string`. Filter flags: skip reads with any mask bits set [UNMAP,SECONDARY,QCFAIL (when use UMI) or UNMAP,SECONDARY,QCFAIL,DUP (otherwise)]

count_orphan.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If use, do not skip anomalous read pairs
count_orphan.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If use, do not skip anomalous read pairs.

min_mapq.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `20`. Minimum MAPQ for read filtering.

min_len.description: Type: `integer`, default: `30`. Minimum mapped length for read filtering
min_len.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `30`. Minimum mapped length for read filtering.

output.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `cellsnp_out/`. Output directory for VCF and sparse matrices.

nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.

param_list.description: Type: `string`, example: `my_params.yaml`. Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel
param_list.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `my_params.yaml`. Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel. A `param_list` can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml blob.

* A list of maps (as-is) where the keys of each map corresponds to the arguments of the pipeline. Example: in a `nextflow.config` file: `param_list: [ ['id': 'foo', 'input': 'foo.txt'], ['id': 'bar', 'input': 'bar.txt'] ]`.
* A csv file should have column names which correspond to the different arguments of this pipeline. Example: `--param_list data.csv` with columns `id,input`.
* A json or a yaml file should be a list of maps, each of which has keys corresponding to the arguments of the pipeline. Example: `--param_list data.json` with contents `[ {'id': 'foo', 'input': 'foo.txt'}, {'id': 'bar', 'input': 'bar.txt'} ]`.
* A yaml blob can also be passed directly as a string. Example: `--param_list "[ {'id': 'foo', 'input': 'foo.txt'}, {'id': 'bar', 'input': 'bar.txt'} ]"`.

When passing a csv, json or yaml file, relative path names are relativized to the location of the parameter file. No relativation is performed when `param_list` is a list of maps (as-is) or a yaml blob.
